summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeSustainable PackagingGive BackINKEY Retinol Eye Cream is a nightly eye cream that reduces the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles while providing extra support for your most delicate and fragile skin.
details: DetailsBenefitsFormulated with slow-release vitamin A derivatives to support natural collagen production, this cream is gentle enough to use around your eyes—without fear of irritation.This product is an Allure Best of Beauty award winner.Key IngredientsVitalease™ (Retinol): Is a stabilized, slow-release retinoid formula that avoids irritation.Item 2641806How To UseSuggested Usage:-Apply in the evening, one to two times per week to start out.-Increase usage depending on your skin's tolerance.-Gently pat a small amount around your eye contours with your finger.-Follow with your favorite moisturizers or oils.Beauty tip:-Pair with The INKEY List Retinol Anti-Aging Serum (sold separately), which uses slow-release technology to target fine lines and wrinkles---without irritation.IngredientsAqua (Water/Eau), Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Glycerin, Butylene Glycol, Pentaerythrityl Distearate, Shea Butter Ethyl Esters, Cetearyl Olivate, Phenoxyethanol, Benzyl Alcohol, Sorbitan Olivate, Acrylates/C10-30 Alkyl Acrylate Crosspolymer, Sodium Hydroxide, Sodium Hyaluronate, Sodium Stearoyl Glutamate, Copernicia Cerifera Cera, Propanediol, Glycogen, Sodium Gluconate, Retinol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Dehydroacetic Acid, Citric Acid, Helianthus Annuus Seed Oil, 1,2-Hexanediol, Caprylyl Glycol, Disodium Cocoamphodiacetate, Tocopherol, Xanthan Gum, Humulus Lupulus Extract.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:-Apply in the evening, one to two times per week to start out.-Increase usage depending on your skin's tolerance.-Gently pat a small amount around your eye contours with your finger.-Follow with your favorite moisturizers or oils.Beauty tip:-Pair with The INKEY List Retinol Anti-Aging Serum (sold separately), which uses slow-release technology to target fine lines and wrinkles---without irritation.

faceoff_positive.comments: I bought this eye cream on Saturday after not being able to purchase the one I had wanted from another brand - thank god!!! It is now Monday and I can see a marked improvement after using it 4 times. It is amazing. I have crepey skin on my eyelids, puffiness, and sometimes get excema on my eyes (although it is not active now and I wouldn't use this if it were). It's nearly all corrected and it hasn't effected my excema!! I will definitely be adding this to my skin care list. My eyes are moisturised, the creepy texture has gone and the puffiness is severely reduced. Perfect!
faceoff_positive.headline: Brilliant

faceoff_negative.comments: I use a whole range of Inkey list products, they are my go to brand for skincare, and believe me - I've tried every brand going. But unfortunately, this is one product that I do not recommend :( I don't have sensitive skin (my skin doesn't really react to a lot of products, fortunately), but 3 weeks in and I've had to stop using this. First week, I used it once a week, then twice a week after (left about 3/4 days between each day), and all used at night, not used with other AHAs or BHAs. 2 days ago, both eyes felt a bit itchy but looked fine, then yesterday I noticed my eyes looked dark in the morning, but didn't think much of it. Then last night, my left eye became a little inflamed and very red. Awoke this morning to red, blotchy undereyes and cheekbones on the left side, my eye is irritably itchy. I've used retinol on the face before, and other AHAs and BHAs, but I've never had a reaction like this. Doesn't help that it was more on the pricey side than most products too :( Don't get me wrong, it's a lovely feeling product, creamy and doesn't pill, but unfortunately maybe a bit too strong. Love the Inkey List usually, but not for this retinol eye cream unfortunately.
faceoff_negative.headline: I feel really bad about this, as I love The Inkey list produ
